item.description: Barring any serious objections our March book will be Reading Lolita in Tehran.  The book is part memoir and part literary criticism and social history.  Azar Nafisi returns to her native Iran to teach but finds she needs to eventually resign her position.  She starts a weekly study of Western literature for seven of her former students.  Reading Lolita chronicles their experience and the place of literature in the art of life.

group.name: The Brookline Book Club Meetup Group

item.name: Reading Lolita in Tehran: A Memoir in Books by Azar Nafisi
